Nanoemulsions have been widely used as nanocarriers of hydrophobic drugs and essential oils. The majority of NEs are dispersions of nanometric oil droplets in water stabilized by surfactants. The droplet size of a nanoemulsion is typically in the range of 20-200 nm.
